Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: A O
Reviews.Content: We didn't know that the night club on the roof of the hotel was more important than it's guests. Even the Sign for the hotel makes it very clear!! We did not sleep our 1st night, and quickly figured out that we needed to buy ear plugs. We did ask for a different room, it would not make a difference. All the night patrons walk up and down the stairs adjacent to the guests rooms. The location is on the main street of 5th Ave, but our issue was the street traffic that past by our room all hours of the night.... HORRIBLE Not worth the price, we did our research and you can find a MUCH better deal for not having to deal with these issues... :( I recommend to stay on the beach... much-much better!!! Playa del Carmen is soooo amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would give it 4/5 but...”
Reviews.Author: jssurleplateau
Reviews.Content: Lovely little boutique Hotel located on the very touristy 5th avenue in Playa del Carmen. The good: clean and modern rooms, cotton sheets, comfortable beds, great location, great bar on the roof, access to many beach clubs, nice little mini bar, breakfast often included, not expensive hotel, professional and friendly front desk service. Lots of positives. The not so good: on 5th avenue. Noisy in the front rooms and there is a lounge and bar on the roof. You sort of can't get away from the noise. People coming down from the bar are usually quite noisy (between midnight and 1 AM). Turn the aircon on max to drown out the noise. There are issues with the wifi: if you are on Apple (phones, pads, etc.) you might not be able to log in (grrrrr). The front desk does have a computer and printer, but not connected to each other (grrrrr). Had to go to an internet cafe! This time was a bit too noisy and the wifi issue got to me. I had to go to Starbucks or other restaurants to get wifi. I would still recommend this hotel and I will go back. I had been there two years ago and they have made improvements. Perhaps they will be even better the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location + Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly4Life
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 2min from the beach reserved spot, 5min from the bus station (great if you decide to take ADO from/to airport or visit other locations/touristic spots), 5min walk to collectivo (public transit min van $2/pp), 3min from walmart (in case you forgot some medications or so on) and 7min walk to the ferry to cozumel. Front desk staff are very nice/helpful! They recommended some good restaurants which we tried/loved. The included breakfast @ Me Pueblo was very good and right accross the street.Hotel Wi-fi very good. The rooftop bar makes great drinks except kinda dead on days we went. The only thing the hotel should improve..is adjusting the site super work hours so they start repairs/work after 9am so guests can sleep a bit longer. I already recommended this hotel to 2 co-workers and would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: Anastaci
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern, clean. Right on 5th ave, so you are close to beach and shopping. Beds are firm, plus you get a beach pass for the club.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for those who want to party all night long.”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: I have to say the location was ideal. It was just 1 block away from Mosquito beach and 4 blocks away from Wal-Mart. It is right on the corner of 5th Avenue and 8th street in the middle of the action. The rooms were clean and modern HOWEVER, and there is this big BUT- it was noisy in the rooms from the bar they operate on the roof top. The club plays loud music every night, especially more so on the weekends that if you were hoping for some rest and sleep at night, then you went to the wrong place. The boom and echo reverberates in the room (we were on the second floor- maybe better if we stayed on the 1st floor rooms) that even using ear plugs did not help. Its that LOUD!. Pluses: Location and attentive and helpful staff especially the rotating concierge/receptionists- kudos to them. Great bunch. Would I stay again in this Hotel? No. Unfortunately, though I like the convenience, I still need to sleep after all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: Marija83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in for 5 nights my husband , baby 3 months old and myself. Hotel is in the center of everything , shopping and restaurant area, clean and the stuff is very kind I will highly recommend this place , worth every money and they have included breakfast in price, witch is also nice in the restaurant cross the street . Especially for young people , even with the kids too. The only thing was missing is the internet , they didn't had in our room on the second floor , so was really hard to go every time at the lobby to check emails. Hope they will resolve this problem soon. All the best

Reviews.Title: “best room ever”
Reviews.Author: toitro
Reviews.Content: it looks like a small hotel from the outside but when you get in, a state of the art, very modern, and highly techie hotel!!!the stuff so great, you enjoy every minute! the room is very spacious & comfortable, with modern furniture! the view from the room is on the 5'th avnida, and one can go upstairs to the Aztec bar there the view is to the sea!! every morning is a charm with the luxurious breakfast(the buffet). one can enjoy a good cup of coffee all day long!!and that a good thing in mexico! a good leverage on the other hotels! and the free fast internet, so good! the beach club is nice, but the location isnt so good because of the boats..

Reviews.Title: “Small and cute with everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: JESSTMENA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, there are rooms and a restaurant in the roof, the staff is very kind and they helped me in every moment. The decoration is nice, kind of minimalism style, you have good coffee, tv, air conditioner, etc, in general the rooms are very comfortable. You have two options for breakfast included in the fare, both of them are good, one is the restaurant "el pueblo" and the other one is the one I've must loved it's Indigo beach club, in there there's buffet and you have access to the beach club, so it´s amazing to have breakfast at the beach and then you can go for margaritas with mezcal...amazing. The location is great you´re close to everything, you just have to walk 5 or 10 minutes to reach the beach, nightclubs, reataurants, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, the rooms are very nice and modern in the best location”
Reviews.Author: Filadelfo
Reviews.Content: I expended four great nights in a luxury room in this very modern hotel, that has a great location and a spectacular the terrace " Bar azotea" that is a nice place to have great martinis and to enjoy some of the most famous DJ. Without any doubt, one of the best hotels that I ever been in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Cool little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gianni026
Reviews.Content: We were only there for one night, but we found the staff to be extremely friendly and accomodating. The hotel was very cool. Well appointed, well situated. The beach club was a bit of a hike but well worth it, it was pretty chic. The place was clean. And the biggest surprise of all was the price--extremely affordable. The only complaint is there is quite a lot of noise from outside, but that is because of the location. Our room basically overlooked the busy 5th St. shopping/entertainment area. Would definitely stay again, and recommend strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again, thank you”
Reviews.Author: asiyahirji
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely amazing. We loved the roof-top, the gorgeous sofas and fantastic drinks. We will be back and will tell our friends and family to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ABT12
Reviews.Content: I spent with my colleagues two weeks at El Punto as we visited the region during the COP 16 in late 2010. This is a great place to stay, excellent service, price, quality and lively environment!

Reviews.Title: “¡El hotel era hermoso y la posición era PERFECTA!”
Reviews.Author: G4mannn
Reviews.Content: Stayed from November 17th to 21st....Was a little stressed with traffic in PDC but after I started to drive like the locals, it was easy to find this beautiful little boutique hotel. Great location on 5th ave, close to ferry pier and right in the heart of the shopping/nitelife scene. The hotel staff was superb, especially the front desk (Thanks Cecilia!) in providing us with almost anything we requested. The bar on top of Hotel el Punto, La Azolea, was great also. Thursday nite my wife was surprised to free cucumber martinis and the Tapas are incredible! I would not hesitate to refer ANYONE to stay at this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy for a siesta”
Reviews.Author: honnybunny
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling to Playa Del Carmen for the last 15 years and this is the worst hotel by far. Beautiful hotel, most beautiful part of the room was the shower. The nightclub/terrasse on the roof is bringing lots of girls with high heels anytime of the day and night. so don't expect to sleep during your vacation. At the end of the afternoon that part of the 5th avenue is so busy and on top of that you have the mariachis from "La Parilla" in front of the hotel ...forget the siesta! The pictures on the web sites shows a "kind" of pool on the roof but it is deep enough to have water to your ankles...a bit disapointing for someone who loves swimming. By chance I had a great deal on the price because for sure I will go back to my old habits in Playa next time to Riviera Caribe Maya or Casa Ticul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Palma27
Reviews.Content: For the most part, my husband and I enjoyed our stay here. We booked a Master Suite and got a nice large room on the corner of the building overlooking 5th Ave with a large wrap-around balcony. The room was roomy and beautiful with new contemporary decor. The king bed was comfortable but due to the early morning (5am) construction on top of our heads at the roof-top bar, our sleep was interrupted 2 mornings in a row. If you like to go to bed before 1am, forget about it! It's extremely noisy outside on 5th Ave and from the bar upstairs. The music is very loud. We had to wear ear plugs every night. If it rains a lot, the hotel rooms leak! We had 3 separate water leaks in our room the first night there due to a few rain storms. The staff were quick to bring piles of towels and a humidifier. The leaks stopped the next day. The daily breakfast at Indigo beach club was sufficient for us. Lots to choose from. We enjoyed this every morning. And, yes. As the last reviewer mentioned, there was a very large dead cockroach trapped in the glass flooring outside our room. But, we weren't grossed out by it, we thought it looked kinda cool!

Reviews.Title: “Look Around...”
Reviews.Author: travels120000
Reviews.Content: I give this an average rating because I paid 70$ for it and for 70$ it was average, if I paid 150$ I would say it was really bad. I feel bad saying not so nice things because I believe that they try but I am being honest. Pro's 1) Location is wonderful 2) Staff is extremely nice when they are telling you the internet doesn't work or you can't have the room you paid extra for.... I mean it they apologize, I am not being sarcastic. Apologies are hard to come by these days and I appreciated it. 3)Bed is really comfortable, decor is nice, bottled water is available and there is a good safe 4) the food at breakfast Con's 1) The bathroom smells horrible - I mean vomit bad. 2) The internet does not work apparent there was no signal however every coffee/bar place around the internet worked fine 3) the hotel is really small and there is no pool don't be fooled by the photos 4) restaraunt, lounge was closed while I was there 5) you can hear everything above you 6) there is a dead cockroach trapped between the glass on the second floor in between rooms 28 and 30. I have a photo. I am not going to post it but I can if disputed. 7) breakfast place is a 10 minute walk, can't just go grab something and come back

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the best location”
Reviews.Author: RanSegall
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is located on the main avenue of playa, 1 min from the beach, absolutely great location (also 5 min walk from bus station). the breakfast is really good, served on a beach club where you can then stay and get a sun bed / chair and towels (included). rooms are really nice and comfortable (we had a nice view of the avenue on 2nd floor). staff was helpful and they let us leave our suitcase there for 2 days after we left. we absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but know what to expect here.”
Reviews.Author: WilliNZ
Reviews.Content: Our first night in the region was spent here. Excellent location and a very helpful and friendly staff member at reception who spoke good english. The decor was very modern and currently in excellent condition - not sure how well the domestic style fittings will be looking in a year or so. On the down side our room was under the roof bar, and while street noise was limited by double glazing, the sound of chairs grating on your ceiling till 1am would have been an issue if you wanted to sleep early. But if you want a quiet location I am sure there are plenty without staying right in the midst of things - so up to you. Oh yes, and the wireless internet didn't work when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable atmosphere @ 5th Ave in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: CelesteMattiello
Reviews.Content: I'm from Las Vegas, Nevada and my city is known for having the best hotels in the world. When my boyfriend and I were looking for a hotel to go to Playa del Carmen we found "El Punto Hotel" the photos of their rooms which they are idential as the web page seem very clean and comfort sold us to reserve this Hotel. Upon arrival we were received so loving and smiling Cecilia Gigena at front desk. She was a great help and spetecular in our unforgettable stay. The hotel is economical, romantic, comfortable, clean and especially welcoming. Like my boyfriend, I have recommended the hotel to my friends and family and will continue. We will soon come back and stay once again. It is the place for couples without children because the place surrounds you with romance and tranquility. Before I forget, "La Azotea" restaurant has very rich food and economic drinks.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect location and most beautiful staff”
Reviews.Author: arjosca
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place close to the beach and action of Playa del Carmen, this is an excellent choice. There is no pool, but do you really need one if one of the best beaches in the world is a block away? Rooms are cozy and has all that you'll need: Big bed, Flat Screen, desk, safe, wi-fi, and view of 5th avenue. Yes, it may get noisy due to people buzzing along 5th avenue and musicians across the street, but that just let's you know you're alive. AND there's this really cool coffee maker that makes gourmet coffee and the refill cartridges are complimentary as well. I've been to Playa seven times in the last three years and this is definitely the best boutique hotel I've stayed at. There's also a restaurant & bar on the top level that's action packed at several nights. PLUS, the hotel was kind enough to give us complementary breakfast at the beachside club just several blocks away. Also, this hotel has the most beautiful reception staff in Playa. Always a pleasure to leave and go in the hotel, as well ask for towels & room keys. I don't know their names, but I just call them "Hermosa", "Presciosa", and "Bonita" and I get smiles out of them. (Look it up :) Great hotel. Great location. Great Staff. PERIOD.

Reviews.Title: “location location location..”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl27
Reviews.Content: Just had a quick jaunt down to mexico from Texas and thought it was fabulous. To address a few of the previous reviews - The hotel is beautiful in an understated minimalist boutique way , so if your looking for gigantic overstuffed rooms and bathrooms with excess everywhere then this isnt the place for you. Probably not the best choice for families with young kids but then not many 'boutique' hotels are. Yes the hotel can be noisy at night - and the reason ? because it is in a prime location slap bang in the middle of ALL the life and energy on the main street, and a stones throw from the beach front ,so of COURSE it is going to be noisier than some of the hotels on the outskirts, especially since this is a much smaller hotel. You hear Mariachi, you hear people in the restaurants around, you hear laughing and singing, people dancing,drinking, enjoying themselves, walking from the beach. But isnt that why we go to Mexico? Of course it all dies down at the end of the night anyway, and honestly sitting on the beautiful balcony of this hotel room, looking at the ocean view, and watching and listening to the world go by below was truly an amazing highlight of this trip. Top that off with the staff being super friendly,and accomodating (and curiously all like supermodels as a sidenote?) , mixed with the complimentary breakfast at the stunning Indigo Beach, it all boiled down to a great trip that I would, and will, repeat again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: WongaRach
Reviews.Content: Very easy stay at this hotel. Only a small number of rooms so we were really taken care of. All the staff very nice and bi-lingual. The hotel is new and modern, only downside is the smallish bathrooms. Excellent location, even had a awesome bar at the top with views of the main drag and the ocean. Will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has potential to be superb.”
Reviews.Author: h4ppyc4mper
Reviews.Content: I believe this is a new hotel so I am forgiving the massive leaks that they had to deal with while we were there. You see, there were torrential rain showers for a solid 3 days/nights. If they hotel staff weren't aware of leaks beforehand, they are now and will hopefully seal them off before the next downpour. The staff were top notch. Friendly and helpful. We were given drinks on the house while we waited for them to ready our room, we were given towels to dry off with after getting caught in the rain, and when we bought wine, they had the bartender run to our room to open it. This is an $80 a night hotel people! The service rocked. The negatives were this...the bathroom smell was ungodly. Like the sewer to the entire city had opened up and released all of it's into our nasal passages. And our room's window did not open. There was no escaping the smell. (There are rooms with balconies available...I would recommend getting one of those). *This might have been a result of the rains/flooding and so forth... And lastly, the bed. Such a beautiful room to be ruined by a cheap uncomfortable bed. It's the type of mattress where you run you hand across it and you can feel the metal support rods.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money, Hands Down!!”
Reviews.Author: CrackerClinton
Reviews.Content: Well it all started with a great introduction from the reception desk which at the time was Rachelle. She is fabulous, easy on the eyes, very helpful, and patient since she put up with 3 over excited american men acting as boys. The rooms and hotel in general are nicely decorated, very cool feelling to them. Nice rooms with all the ammenaties needed, very clean and comfortable. The showers are a little bit small if you are lucky enough to have a visitor to wash your back or whatever, Yes! Just deal with it. Other reviews about the noise of people walking up the stairs to the bar and the street noise are probably the same people that sleep with a blindfold and earplugs. It wasn't that bad going to sleep to the slight sound of high heels outside your door, it made for great dreams. The restaurant upstairs had great food, drinks, and the staff was so pleasant and welcoming even to the gringos that couldn't speak Spanish. The location could not have been better, in the heart of the scene and one block from putting your feet in the sand. I owe a big thank you to the rest of the staff at the hotel for making contributing to such a good vacation, this includes Paula and Diana. I love you too. Great Hotel!! Rock

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: SlickDealer
Reviews.Content: Punto has a very nice feel to it when you enter the lobby and rooms. However, do NOT stay in Room 21! There is a strong sewer smell in this room, that they try to hide with a room air freshner in the bathroom. Fortunately, they switched us to a new room that did not have a sewer smell. Also, do not stay at this hotel if you plan on going to bed early, there is lots of noise from the bar above...such as the noise from chairs constantly being moved across the wood floor. The rooms had a nice modern look to them, the lighting in the rooms was cool... Under bed, behind tv, and pendent lights. The bed had some nice sheets and pillows, however it is a bit on the hard side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cool Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: hshepherd99
Reviews.Content: Returned from our trip one week ago and really liked this hotel! Was a bit nervous, as there were not any traveller photos to look at, but what you see on the hotel website is actually what you get in this case. Really can't beat the location; on the corner of 5th and 8th, right in the middle of all the action, and barely one block from the beach. Our room was more than adequete, and had a huge window overlooking 5th Avenue. The bed was really quite nice; my husband says it was more comfortable than our own bed at home! Alot of thought has obviously been put into furnishing this hotel-kind of a relaxed/modern look, very nice. The lounge on the roof was nice, with a little tile pool to dip your feet in and comfortable lounges. Nice to relax with a drink and either look out toward the water or down at the people on 5th. Have to admit, I was very concerned about the possibility of a noisy, party-like atmosphere, but the only noise we ever heard were the sounds of some high-heels on the stairs going to the lounge on the roof a few times-and who can control that?? Didn't really bother us, and I'm a pretty light sleeper. The bathroom is very small, but very nice-vessel sinks, waterfall showerhead, etc. The shower itself is almost the size of the rest of the bathroom, so no worries there. The shower floor is actually teak slats spaced 1/4 inch apart, so the literally goes down the drain- thought that was a nice touch. The front desk has beach towels available, and they hold your room key while you're out as well, so no worries about losing your key. Really can't say enough about the staff-very friendly and helpful. Only wish we could have stayed longer-will definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Modern Boutique Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: This place was great, The hotel is on a great spot in Playa del Carmen. Can't miss it. Modern rooms, but the bathroom was a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eliot503
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, very clean, and the staff is very helpful and extremely nice. Loved the room and the roof top terrace. It was very noisy with all the people going up and down the stairs to the terrace, and the music from the terrace and mariachi bands across the street at the restaurant, but I was very pleased with our stay. If you're looking for quiet, this is not a good choice, but you will be very happy with the accommodations and staff.
